message:
Three points ✅
Clean sheet ✅
Player of the Match ✅

A very happy 20th birthday for Dean Huijsen ✃

A lightning fast start ⚡⚡⚡

It didn't take Antoine Semenyo long to give the Cherries the lead
Feeling the sudden urge to sprint

Especially when you're young, beware of dismissing some things you're curious about as unimportant. You risk pruning off outliers if you do that. A lot of great discoveries have come from investigating things everyone else thought were unimportant.

Doing hard stuff requires distress tolerance. Building distress tolerance requires doing hard stuff. There is no easy entry point. It gets easier by way of recognition. You think "I've been here before". Pretty soon you're seeking that state. That's how you make hard stuff easy.
Every game is a chance to grow. Together, Al Nassr!
Coming back to Expo after spending an hour in Android Studio

ElevenLabs are joining us a Gold Sponsor! ✈ 
They're the ones behind some seriously impressive AI models for voice, speech, and sound effects ✉. 

Thanks for the support! ✆

Tweet of appreciation to White Lotus Season 3 which wrapped up yesterday. Consistently strong since Season 1 on all of cinematography, music, screenplay, casting and acting. Dread building. Meme minting. Cringe inducing. Always a lot to find, analyze and have fun with ❤

Trained a simple GPT on my own tweet history. Very fascinating to explore the 'latent space' of one's own social media personality. Didn't use any fancy techniques, it's just raw next token prediction. Interesting realization though: social media trains *us* more than we train it.

Recent studies confirm what many experience: 15-45 min of strength training 2-3x per week provides powerful mood enhancement & stress reduction effects that persist for days. The biochemical pathways are still being explored but include modulation of BDNF, endocannabinoids & cortisol.
Setting up a new React Native project is easier than ever with the new Expo templates. So happy we've been able to simplify this experience over the years.

The most important knowledge in startups tends not to be declarative but rather intuitive or procedural. It's not stuff you can learn by reading but by doing: how to tell a good idea from a bad one, how to find & motivate great people, how to prioritize.
App.js Conf 2025 tickets now on sale! Early bird until June 1st. Can't wait to see everyone in Krak√≥w for the best React Native conference in Europe! #AppJSConf2025

New AI model architectures to watch in 2025: 1) Sparse MoE-based LLMs 2) Mixture of Visual Experts for multimodal tasks 3) Time-coherent video diffusion models 4) Graph transformers for scientific discovery 5) Sparse LLM-Agent hybrids for more efficient distributed reasoning
